extends Object

Algorithms for trees.

Method Detail

findCenter

public static Node findCenter(InspectableGraph tree)
Returns the center of the tree. The center of the tree is the node that has the greatest minimum distance from each of the root and the leaves.

If the supplied graph is not a single tree, null may be returned.

Parameters:
tree - the graph that represents a tree
Returns:
the center of the tree

findNodeLevels

public static Trees.NodeLevelFinder findNodeLevels(InspectableGraph graph,
                                                   Node root,
                                                   Direction directionToKids)
Executes the node-level finding algorithm on a tree. The tree is contained in the given graph and its root is specified. Also, the direction of edges to be traversed from the root to explore the whole tree is specified.

Parameters:
graph - the graph that contains the tree
root - the root of the tree
directionToKids - the direction of edges from the root (or any node) to its kids
Returns:
a NodeLevelFinder instance corresponding to the analysis of the tree

findDiameter

public static int findDiameter(InspectableGraph graph)
Finds the diameter (number of edges in the longest path) of a tree. The tree is contained in the given graph. The diameter of the empty tree, or a tree with only a single node, is zero.

Parameters:
graph - the graph that contains the tree
Returns:
the diameter of the tree

findDiameter

public static Trees.DiameterFinder findDiameter(InspectableGraph graph,
                                                Node root,
                                                Direction directionToKids)
Finds the diameter (number of edges in the longest path) of each subtree of a tree. The tree is contained in the given graph and its root is specified.

Parameters:
graph - the graph that contains the tree
root - the root of the tree
directionToKids - the direction of edges from the root (or any node) to its kids
Returns:
a DiameterFinder instance correspoding to the analysis of the tree

analyzeSubtrees

public static Trees.SubtreeAnalyzer analyzeSubtrees(InspectableGraph graph,
                                                    Node root,
                                                    Direction directionFromRootToKids)
Finds the number of nodes and leaves for every subtree of the specified tree. A subtree is defined by a node of the tree, and everything below it (itself included) is in the subtree, while its parent and everything else connected to it is not in the subtree (i.e. when a subtree is defined by any other node than the original root, its node count is strictly less than the node count of the complete tree).

Parameters:
graph - the graph that contains the tree
root - the root of the tree
directionToKids - the direction of edges from the root (or any node) to its kids
Returns:
a SubtreeNodeCounter instance corresponding to the analysis of the tree
